DataElement.preferredName: Plasma Zinc Laboratory Test Result Microgram per Deciliter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Plasma Zinc lab test result in ug/dL

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of plasma for zinc._Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation._The determination of the amount of zinc present in a sample.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.:The determination of the amount of zinc present in a sample.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.
The determination of the amount of zinc present in a sample.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Test Result Microgram per Deciliter Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The outcome of a laboratory test measured in Microgram per Deciliter ( ug/dL )

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Test Result Microgram per Deciliter Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The outcome of a laboratory test.:A unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of  one microgram of a substance in unit volume of the mixture equal to one  deciliter. The concept also refers to the unit of mass density (volumic  mass) defined as the density of substance which mass equal to one  microgram occupies the volume one deciliter.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The outcome of a laboratory test.

A unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one microgram of a substance per unit volume of the mixture equal to one deciliter. The concept also refers to the unit of mass density (volumic mass) defined as the density of substance which mass equal to one microgram occupies the volume one deciliter.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
